message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.MA 

This paper is about reinforcement learning, specifically about introducing hindsight to policy gradient methods. The paper discusses the potential benefits of goal-conditional policies and how they can help in defining options for arbitrary subgoals, enabling higher-level planning. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG), Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI), Robotics (cs.RO), Systems and Control (cs.SY), or Multiagent Systems (cs.MA) sub-categories. Among these, Machine Learning (cs.LG) is the most likely sub-category as the paper focuses on introducing hindsight to policy gradient methods, which are a popular class of machine learning algorithms for reinforcement learning. Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) is also likely as the paper discusses the potential benefits of goal-conditional policies, which are relevant to AI research. Robotics (cs.RO) and Systems and Control (cs.SY) are also possible sub-categories as the paper discusses the potential benefits of higher-level planning, which is relevant to robotics and control systems. Multiagent Systems (cs.MA) is the least likely sub-category as the paper does not explicitly discuss multiagent systems, but the potential benefits of goal-conditional policies may be relevant to multiagent systems research.
